message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.DS 

The paper focuses on information retrieval (IR) systems and their performance, specifically in the context of neural IR re-ranking models. This places it squarely within the cs.IR sub-category. However, the paper also discusses natural language processing (NLP) models (such as BERT) and their impact on IR performance, which could potentially place it in the cs.CL sub-category as well. Additionally, the paper discusses the trade-off between performance and effectiveness, which is a common theme in machine learning (ML) and could place it in the cs.LG sub-category. The paper also mentions hardware acceleration, which could potentially place it in the cs.CV sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes to extend the OSIRRC docker-based replicability infrastructure with performance-focused benchmark scenarios, which could potentially place it in the cs.DS sub-category.
